metadata.abstract: © 2019 The Author(s).Background: Gene is a key step in genome annotation. Ab initio gene prediction enables gene annotation of new genomes regardless of availability of homologous sequences. There exist a number of ab initio gene prediction agents and they have been widely used for gene annotation for various species. However, existing agents are not optimized for identifying genes with highly variable GC content. In addition, some genes in grass genomes exhibit a sharp 5 ′- 3′ decreasing GC content gradient, which is not carefully modeled by available gene prediction agents. Thus, there is still room to improve the sensitivity and accuracy for predicting genes with GC gradients. Results: In this work, we designed and implemented a new hidden Markov model (HMM)-based ab initio gene prediction agent, which is optimized for finding genes with highly variable GC contents, such as the genes with negative GC gradients in grass genomes. We tested the agent on three datasets from Arabidopsis thaliana and Oryza sativa. The results showed that our agent can identify genes missed by existing agents due to the highly variable GC contents. Conclusions: GPRED-GC can effectively predict genes with highly variable GC contents without manual intervention. It provides a useful complementary agent to existing ones such as Augustus for more sensitive gene discovery. The source code is freely available at https://sourceforge.net/projects/gpred-gc/.
metadata.title: GPRED-GC: A Gene PREDiction model accounting for 5 ′- 3′ GC gradient
